column1: Chronic inflammatory polyneuropathy involves nerve swelling and irritation (inflammation) that leads to a loss of strength or sensation.
Chronic inflammatory demyelinating polyneuropathy (CIDP) is the most common chronic neuropathy caused by an abnormal immune response.

It may occur with other conditions, such as: - Autoimmune disorders - Chronic hepatitis - Diabetes - HIV - Inflammatory bowel disease - Systemic lupus erythematosus - Lymphoma - Paraneoplastic syndrome - Thyrotoxicosis - Side effects of medicines to treat cancer or HIV
